title: Blended Curriculum Based on Situated Learning for Medical Students' Professional Development and Identity Formation

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational medical knowledge or clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: A practical curriculum addressing medical students' lack of professionalism and identity formation issues, promoting self-reflection and value internalization through role modeling, field practice, and small-group discussions.

learning_goals: Learners can identify core values as healthcare professionals (ethics, responsibility, communication) and establish action plans within four weeks.
Learners can describe three or more elements of professional identity through role model observation and apply them to their own cases.
Learners can analyze dilemma situations occurring in medical settings based on field practicum experiences and propose solutions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
